sn20.2:4.2: Then the Buddha, picking up a little bit of dirt under his fingernail, addressed the mendicants:
sn20.2:4.3: “What do you think, mendicants? Which is more: the little bit of dirt under my fingernail, or this great earth?”
sn20.2:4.4: “Sir, the great earth is far more.
sn20.2:4.5: The little bit of dirt under your fingernail is tiny.
sn20.2:4.6: Compared to the great earth, it can’t be reckoned or compared, it’s not even a fraction.”
sn20.2:4.7: “So too the sentient beings reborn on land are few, while those reborn in water are many.
sn20.2:4.8: while those not reborn as humans are many.
sn20.2:4.9: So you should train like this:
